formalParameter.description: The name of a saved SCM configuration.
This option will clone a repo into a newly created directory.
This option will overwrite a repository if it already exists.
Create a shallow clone with a history truncated to the specified number of revisions.
The Commit Hash to update the index. Note: This will move the HEAD.
The root of the destination directory for files
Provide the name of a specific tag to checkout after the clone command.
The Git Repo (i.e. git://server/repository)
The Git branch (i.e. experimental)
Results will be saved into this property/property sheet.

procedure.description: Collects reporting data for new api.

formalParameter.description: The name of a saved SCM configuration.

This mode is provided to let a user perform a WHAT IF analysis before enabling automatic reporting. If this mode is set, no metadata will be set and reports will be not be sent to the Reporting Server. Instead detailed information about each object retrieved from SonarQube that includes transformation, mapping and payload, will be shown in the summary logs.
The path or URL to the repository to pull from, e.g. 'https://github.com/username/reponame'.
Name of the git branch to use. Default will be master.
SHA of the earliest commit from which data needs to be collected. Needs to be setup only for the first run.

If provided, matching string will be removed from file path before sending report. For example if file path is /opt/repo/file1, file prefix = /opt/repo will resolve it to /file1. Similarly file prefix = /opt/repo/ will resolve it to file1.

Property sheet where run metadata will be stored. Optional field. If omited, /mySchedule/@PLUGIN_KEY@-%JobName%-%Report Object Type% will be used for schedule contest. For all other contexts root is /myProject.
Enter the Template for the URL to be resolved. For example the template for a URL https://github.com/somerepo/commit/a12b3 would be ${repoUrl}/commit/${commitId}
If set, the report will include file details.

Git fields that identify the release that the feature or defect is associated with. E.g., "commit.scmUrl: codeCommit.scmUrl, commit.author: codeCommit.author". The identified fields will be used to populate the target fields identified in the report object association from feature to release.
Allows user to provide perl script for payload customization. This method will be invoked by plugin with 2 parameters. 1st parameter is context object, 2nd is payload object.
If set the summary logs will be written with the highest verbosity for the entire procedure.
The name of the configuration to be created

procedure.description: Run the agent side of a preflight workflow

formalParameter.description: The name of a saved SCM configuration. (Required)
The destination for files
The path or URL to the repository that preflight will pull from before overlaying files. (Required)

procedure.description: Example of how to use getSCMTag

formalParameter.description: The configuration name
The local repository
The Git branch to watch
If specified, the local repository will be updated from the remote repository before the git log command. ie.: 'git://server/repo.git'.
value of 1 means use git ls-remote to check if remote repository has a change value of 0 means perform a checkout and git log and parse results to determine if there has been a change
value of 0 means do not monitor tags, only monitor commits value of 1 means monitor tags in addition to commits

procedure.description: If the job's outcome is successful, update a last successful snapshot property to the revision used in the job.

formalParameter.description: The configuration name
